page.title: 04RANSKILL WALK (A)
page.content: For our walk around Ranskill,we first went up Station Road to the Crossroad. Then we went up Blyth Road to where there is a large coal stream.Bircotes Pit is going to expand to a super-pit, running under Ranskill and other villages.Then we turned right, down a small road towards Serlby.We passed fields of Wheat,Sugar beet,Peas and Potatoes.We were walking past the golf course when we saw racing horses being trained by one of my friends' dad.On the walk the boys were challenging our knowledge of flowers,so we astounded them by naming all the flowers we saw, Speedwell,Forget-me-not,Nettle,Red and White Campian,Poppy and Cow Parsley, half of which the boys had never heard of! We were now walking down Folly Nook Lane,we turned down by the railway and back to school again.UGHH!
